programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones put their bidding skills to the test against Hawaiian locals, and discover a vintage motor scooter and some antique Polynesian tattoo tools.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders head for the East Texas town of Tyler, where Jenny finds a valuable piece of musical memorabilia - but one of her competitors ends up out of pocket.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba try to keep their lucky streak going as the bidders return to old haunts, while Jenny discovers her inner ballerina.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The staff get the chance to buy a rare 1970s Indian mini-motorcycle.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers deal with the most expensive item they have ever appraised, while Rick assesses a 1948 electric shock therapy machine and an off-road vehicle.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: A tense season takes its toll on the hunters, with one veteran spraying his partner with bullet fragments. Elsewhere, a conflict between brothers nearly comes to violence.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of the Jamie Davis Heavy Rescue team that patrols the Coquihalla Highway on Canada's Cascade Mountains.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team considers buying a mysterious 17th-century treasure chest that no one has yet managed to open.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The Las Vegas pawnbrokers investigate a huge gold bar thought to be from a 14th-century shipwreck, and consider a collection of baseball memorabilia in mint condition.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Actor Mackenzie Crook, wildlife presenter Chris Packham, writer and broadcaster Victoria Coren Mitchell and comedian Rhod Gilbert join David Mitchell and Lee Mack for the comedy panel show. Rob Brydon chairs as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with odd personal statements that may or may not be true.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition of Sandi Toksvig's first episode as host of the panel game, in which she invites Alan Davies, Cariad Lloyd, Romesh Ranganathan and Phill Jupitus to answer questions on subjects associated with the letter n. Since the questions are impossible to answer, points are awarded for being interesting rather than correct.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The team are arrested by the Mechanoid Intergalactic Liberation Front, while Kryten is given a new life of pampering and luxury. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Doc Martin star Martin Clunes hosts an extended edition of the satirical quiz from June 2016, with comedian Jason Manford and Labour MP Jess Phillips joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines that week.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: Fig Biscuits and Inspirational Toilet Rolls
programme.desc: Arkwright decides to open the shop before dawn to catch the morning rush and tries a special promotion to get rid of some of the goods, including fig biscuits and toilet rolls.

programme.title: Prince Philip: The Plot to Make a King
programme.desc: Secret History documentary telling the inside story of the dynastic tensions that were unleashed when Princess Elizabeth, the future queen, fell in love with Prince Philip. It was felt that Philip was rough and ill-mannered - and with the Second World War still fresh in most people's minds, the royal and political elite disliked his German roots. But following the death of King George VI in 1952, the establishment feared a dynastic coup, with the Queen torn between the two sides. The documentary examines the complexities and frustrations of the royal marriage, as the monarch struggled to reconcile the love of her husband with the suspicions of her family and her government.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong finally arrive at the end of their gruelling journey in Dawson City. They set up a traditional mining camp in the heart of the gold fields, before facing their next challenge. They have just five days to find gold in an area that has already been heavily mined, and can only use the back-breaking methods of the 19th-century early pioneers.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Jackie Stewart the Flying Scot
programme.desc: Profile of the legendary racing driver, tracing his early career and influence on Formula One.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The crimes of Henri Landru, who targeted lonely and vulnerable women during the First World War. He seduced them with promises of marriage and lured them to houses outside Paris where the women vanished. With the police uninterested in investigating the disappearances, two women took it upon themselves to pursue Landru.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The bravery of the 333rd Field Artillery Battalion, a depleted unit of African-American soldiers who risked everything to fight off the Nazis at Bastogne, Belgium.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The months following prime minister Neville Chamberlain's declaration of war against Germany, in which the only casualties on the home front were those who had to endure the blackouts. Elsewhere in Europe, the Nazi war machine cut a swathe of destruction. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Concrete channels hidden in a mountaintop forest, a collapsing bridge, a marooned military base and the upright rusting carcass of ship.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough examines how fleas are able to jump great distances for their size and attempts to discover how fast a cheetah can run.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores animals that have developed tool-making skills to help them survive, including orangutans and crows.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Broadcaster Chris Tarrant continues his travels along the world's most challenging railways. Here he attempts to cross the Andes, setting off from the coast of Chile and heading for the Bolivian capital of Sucre. Along the way he traverses some of the driest and most inhospitable environments on the planet, hitches rides on unusual trains and deals with altitude sickness at more than 3,000 metres.

programme.title: Africa
programme.desc: David Attenborough explores the wildlife eking out an existence in and around the scorching wilderness of the Sahara, where only the toughest survive. It's a constant struggle against dehydration, as zebra battle over dwindling rivers, camels search for water and tiny barn swallows navigate thousands of square miles of barren sand to find a life-saving oasis. The naked mole rat avoids the heat by living a subterranean existence, while the silver ant is able to take on the midday sun - but needs a 'spacesuit' to do it.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Rare footage of the elusive animals that live in the unforgiving environment of the world's mountain ranges. A female snow leopard with a cub ends up caught between two rival males, grizzly bears rub themselves up against trees in an attempt to shed their winter fur, and golden eagles hunt over snow-capped peaks.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Shanghai Tower, which at a height of 632 metres is the second tallest building in the world, With a weight of 850,000 tons, it has been built to withstand winds of typhoon proportions.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of Major General Robert Laycock who rallied his ill-equipped troops to see off a German attack on Crete, Greece.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How, in 1940, the French Army suffered a heavy defeat after underestimating the Nazis' strength while relying on First World War strategies and equipment to defend its frontiers. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Forgotten relics from the defence of America's homeland, concealed by the banks of the Mississippi, and a concrete behemoth on the French coast that proved invulnerable to attacks.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: The team acquire a personalised Victorian pistol and try to track down the original owner. A customer brings in brasses that his dad brought back from the Somme.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Nurse Gladys Emmanuel's washing-machine breaks down, and Arkwright decides to try and lure her into his home with the offer of his vintage machine.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville struggles to find some privacy when the milkwoman makes a pass at him. Nurse Gladys Emmanuel steps in by persuading Arkwright to take her to a hotel.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: Fig Biscuits and Inspirational Toilet Rolls
programme.desc: Arkwright decides to open the shop before dawn to catch the morning rush and tries a special promotion to get rid of some of the goods, including fig biscuits and toilet rolls.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher helps cellmate Godber make it through the night, calling on his unpredictable and limitless imagination to while away the hours. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Tony tries to help Jacko forget Julie by taking him on a double date, while Jessica exposes corruption in high places. The McCleods hear the patter of tiny feet and recent events finally take their toll on Mark, who makes an inspection of the barracks go with something of a bang.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Drysdale decides to send the boys on an escort mission to Africa, but it proves to be a fiasco on every level - particularly for Jeremy, who first refuses to follow the CO's orders to the letter, then has a bitter reunion with ex-wife Lilian that sets the sparks flying. Mark also resurfaces, as a mercenary soldier fighting for the enemy and keen to gain revenge on his former King's Own colleagues.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: One Step Too Far - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Laura looks at Gabriel with new eyes when he takes a surprisingly compassionate approach to her wayward son Liam, who is being bullied because of her job. Adam tries to mend fences with the rank-and-file officers by going out on the beat with June - only to lose his cool completely when a traffic accident triggers painful memories. Samantha jeopardises Jo's investigation by poaching her informant, leading to a bitter row, while Gary's future on the force looks uncertain after he reacts to Suzie's constant needling with a very public outburst.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Diane is assigned to work with Nick, and when they find a cocaine package inside a patient, the duo end up lying to Ric and the police. Sam tries to set up Joseph with a new nurse, but he is not interested. Ryan resurfaces, and Mark tries to persuade him to turn himself in, but the terrified teenager lashes out and stabs Matt. Patsy Byrne guest stars.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: The staff get into the spirit of Halloween and Adam begins his first shift as a nurse in A&E. A sombre Eve, shaken after treating a drug overdose patient, makes a life-changing decision. Chloe gets into another argument with Tina - and reveals she is having an abortion the very next day. Hospital drama, starring Cathy Shipton, Barbara Marten, Claire Goose and Rebecca Wheatley.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: One Step Too Far - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. Laura begins to feel increasingly unfulfilled in her role as PCSO, and announces to Smithy that she wants to become a PC. Gina's old flame Jonathan Fox returns to Sun Hill, and Neil pressures Gary to drop his bullying accusations against Susie Sim. Gabriel warns an increasingly infatuated Sheelagh not to get involved with him, while Samantha continues to needle Jo, fuelling an already volatile situation.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Phil takes Hattie down to Southampton to look for Steve and while there meets a Romanian girl who has just come over to England. Hattie finds Steve but is unable to change his mind.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The raft race takes place but George is called away when Kelly goes into labour. Meanwhile, Ariadne has news for Nick and Sicknote's secret is revealed.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Archie tries to keep Paul's revelation that he is Hector's son a secret, hoping to protect Molly. But Lexie is determined they should face up to the reality of the situation sooner rather than later and persuades Paul to stay at Glenbogle until the dust has settled.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: While attending a conference, David receives a job offer that seems impossible to refuse _ will he leave Simon in the lurch? Karen anxiously prepares to meet her estranged mother for lunch, and Chris learns the truth about Beth's marital status. Anna treats a man whose health is suffering due to his job in a textile factory, but ends up equally concerned about his wife's welfare as she struggles to look after her husband and two lazy teenagers. Drama, starring Leslie Ash and Philip Middlemiss.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Mrs Boswell reports Freddie's disappearance - as Jack and Leonora discover that somebody else is looking for him.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Ted falls in love with a piano-playing guest at the holiday camp, but romance proves difficult with her overbearing mother in the way. Classic comedy, starring Paul Shane, David Griffin and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean ponders giving up work and handing the company over to Judith and Sandy - much to Lionel's delight. Starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: The Changing Face of Rural Blamire
programme.desc: Thinking they have to much free time on their hands, the trio decide to find some kind of occupation. They encounter a dodgy bankrupted dealer who persuades them to sell his new product - with disastrous results, particularly for Blamire. Michael Bates, Bill Owen and Peter Sallis star.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Jo Mills is persuaded to act on behalf of a drug addict, who went on the run 16 years previously after being charged with attempted murder. The defendant alleges detectives forced him to sign a confession and allowed him to escape custody - leaving Deed to decide if they should be charged with perverting the course of justice. Starring Martin Shaw, Donald Sinden, Jenny Seagrove, Caroline Langrishe and Robert Cavanah.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The gun used to kill a boxer is discovered at the scene of an armed robbery 15 years later, prompting the team to reinvestigate the case. Twenty-one-year-old Eddie Mayfair was shot dead a week after winning an important bout, which left his opponent seriously injured and unable to carry on his career. The detectives initially suspect revenge as a motive, but the case is complicated when they uncover the rivalries and money-making aspects of the sport. Guest starring Maggie O'Neill (Shameless) and Chloe Howman (Casualty).

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The discovery of human remains in an urban canal is linked to the unsolved murder of a prison governor 15 years earlier, leading the team to seek out the original suspects. However, it is not long before the prison psychologist, who is married to the victim's daughter, finds himself personally embroiled in the investigation. Meanwhile, Boyd launches a search for his son Luke.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A round-up of all the day's main news stories from the UK and around the world.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Sky News

programme.title: All Elite Wrestling: Dynamite
programme.desc: Action from the latest edition of the weekly AEW event, featuring all of the biggest stars on the roster, including Adam Page, Chris Jericho, Cody and Jon Moxley.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: 1000 Heartbeats
programme.desc: Vernon Kay hosts the quiz show in which contestants' pulses are monitored and they must complete seven rounds before their hearts beat 1,000 times to win Â£25,000 - meaning they will have to stay calm under pressure or risk losing the jackpot.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: More celebrity interviews and topical debate from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by Monica Galetti for a culinary journey around Oxford, where they pay a visit to Raymond Blanc at his restaurant Le Manoir aux Quat'Saisons, and sample some of his award-winning dishes. They take a trip up the river to a farm where they pick raspberries for a pudding, and James prepares a chicken dish with morels in the grounds of Raymond's restaurant.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five steampunk enthusiasts answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Martin's medical career remains under scrutiny, as a GMC representative arrives to assess him and his surgery, while having resigned from her job as headmistress at the local school, Louisa pursues a new career in child counselling. Elsewhere, Al accidentally proposes to Morwenna, and Mrs Tishell has a new lease on life.

programme.title: Tales from the Coast with Robson Green
programme.desc: The actor explores the hidden coves and remote islands of Pembrokeshire and meets up with former Soldier Soldier co-star and singing partner Jerome Flynn - who is now living on the coast. They go sea kayaking around Ramsey Island and Robson attempts to navigate some of the most dangerous tidal rapids off British shores. On Skokholm Island, he also spends 24 hours living and working with its only human inhabitants - wildlife wardens Giselle Eagle and Richard Brown.

programme.title: Quiz
programme.desc: Charles returns for a second night in the hot seat with a new strategy. After his previously hopeless performance, he proves massively successful, his dithering answers invariably turning out to be right. However, the production team find his sudden change of fortunes suspicious, and begin looking into an unusual pattern of coughing from the studio audience.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Believe Me: The Cyprus Rape Case
programme.desc: Julie Etchingham talks to the teenager at the centre of the infamous case, who reported being gang raped to the police in Cyprus, only to end up on trial for making the story up - which she and her lawyers have strenuously denied. The programme examines new footage from the case, and questions the circumstances that led her to apparently retract her allegations under police cross examination without a lawyer present.

programme.title: Quiz
programme.desc: Charles returns for a second night in the hot seat with a new strategy. After his previously hopeless performance, he proves massively successful, his dithering answers invariably turning out to be right. However, the production team find his sudden change of fortunes suspicious, and begin looking into an unusual pattern of coughing from the studio audience.

programme.title: The UK Music Video Chart

programme.title: Katy Perry: Then To Now
programme.desc: Katy's taken over the world! We've gone back right to the beginning to show all her greatest hits from then to now.

programme.title: Hit After Hit
programme.desc: Nothing but the biggest hits by your favourite stars back to back.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer and Edd China continue their project to get a 1.8-litre VW Mark 1 Golf GTi in prime condition to go back out on the road.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In the middle of a Minnesota blizzard Mike and Frank face the frost to uncover a rare pair of trucks on farmer Jim's spread. Series following the lives of Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz, two of America's most skilled 'pickers', who travel around the country trawling junk yards, garages, attics and barns for precious objects.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The team builds a Nascar-inspired motorcycle for the Stewart-Haas racing team, and Paul Jr pitches a line of dog toys to a company based in LA.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Kevin ends up battered and bruised after snatching a $1million Falcon 20. Mike is called in to repossess a Cessna 208 Caravan used in the trafficking of exotic animals.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe experiences life working at an exotic animal ranch in Texas, and helps tranquilise and transport two endangered deer for a breeding programme.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: A look at how time-delay locks, brownies, pallet dispensers, and crystal chandeliers are made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The manufacturing documentary continues, detailing how bead wire, mini pepperoni, irrigation sprinklers and leather gloves are created.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The murder of Cambridgeshire 10-year-olds Holly Wells and Jessica Chapman in 2002. Experts study media interviews of their killer, Ian Huntley, to expose his lies.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The case of Tracie Andrews, whose 1996 road rage attack killed her lover Lee Harvey. Plus, Hampshire businessman Mike Gifford-Hull's TV plea for his missing wife Farsi that hid the true facts of her disappearance.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The murder of building society manager Carol Wardell in September 1994, by her husband Gordon. Plus, the 'honour killing' of 17-year-old Shafilea Ahmed in September 2003, suffocated by her parents Iftikhar and Farzana.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The FBI is called in to investigate a double murder after a corrupt local government hinders the police.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: An investigator intervenes at a private animal shelter for 600 dogs, trying to persuade the owner she should reduce numbers in the pack.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney vet Dr Chris Brown attempts to help a lady who runs a shelter for abandoned donkeys. Lisa takes on a six-year-old apprentice who has arrived at Sash with her sick dog, Jelly.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Syndal marries into New York Yankee royalty and her friends come with notepads to help rate each dress. Plus, bride-to-be Danielle returns for her first fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.sub-title: It's a Drag Being a Bridesmaid
programme.desc: Brandon tries to find a dress to complement a client's unique wedding party, including her drag queen 'bridesman'.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A woman getting married at a winery tries to convince her bridesmaids to dress in purple and green to suit her theme.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: When E'terica's fiance questions her taste in wedding gowns, he also tests her self-esteem, while Katy's mother is not ready to let go of her daughter.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride's dream dress is on the line when her mother's budget is challenged, while another customer is an only child and used to getting what she wants.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Robin and Flo make a major faux pas by having two sisters model their wedding dresses for their family side by side.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Sasha is looking for a pink dress to honour her mother's battle with breast cancer, while Penny receives some tough love from her family to help her stand tall.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Tim has his hands full with some lively little Tasmanian Devils, Chris meets a pug with an overly long tongue and Lisa fears for a ragdoll cat's weak legs.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Feisty meerkats are not impressed by a visit from the vet, a cat needs treatment after being mauled by two dogs, and an angry alligator is brought in for x-rays.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Seattle-based punk rocker Brian Barton, guitarist with As Fate Would Have It. The 25-year-old vanished in March 2005, after a bout of depression during which he left the band, broke up with his fiancee and cut ties with his closest friends.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Roxanne Paltauf, who vanished from a motel in Austin Texas in July 2006 after an argument with her boyfriend. After searching 10 acres for the 18-year-old's remains, police came up empty-handed.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: Documentary examining the case of Patti Adkins who vanished in July 2001, shortly after leaving her shift at a Honda factory in Ohio. A police investigation revealed the 29-year-old single mother was making plans for a trip with a mystery boyfriend, but he has never been identified.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: Documentary investigating the case of Toni Lee Sharpless a nurse and mother with a bipolar disorder who vanished in August 2009 after a night out in Gladwyne, Pennsylvania. The car she was travelling in has never been recovered, though it was possibly spotted two weeks later in Camden, New Jersey.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: At over 700lbs, Brianne is on a weight-loss journey to save her own life. But she faces another shock when her husband's health suddenly deteriorates.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Amber, who is 23 and weighs more than 600lb, relies on her family for even the simplest of tasks, so she travels more than 2,000 miles for weight-loss surgery.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three bargain hunters search for valuables at a market in Nantes, then upcycle their goods before selling them on. Jess thinks her fortune lies with a retro laminated kitchen set, Terry acquires a 1970s coffee table, while Dan converts a vintage trunk into a cocktail cabinet. However, it remains to be seen whether the buyers on London's Portobello Road will allow them a profit on their purchases.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: The arrival of a life-sized suit of armour and matching horse amuses staff at the new Hatton Garden shop, while MD James takes a trip down a canal on a barge that a businessman is looking to secure a loan against. A sunseeker hopes to sell some precious family jewellery to help fund a move to Spain, and Lawrence is faced with a mysterious wooden chest thought to have belonged to the royal family.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Susan is struggling with giving up smoking before being eligible for skin reduction surgery. Post-pregnancy Betti Jo is struggling with her weight loss.

programme.title: 1000lb Sisters
programme.desc: Amy and Tammy go to Atlanta to meet Dr Procter to discuss weight-loss surgery. Tammy has a hefty weight loss goal, and the dietician has bad news for Amy.

programme.title: My Big Breasts and Me
programme.desc: Documentary providing an insight into the lives of women with large breasts, including many who are unhappy with their bodies and suffer bullying and physical pain. Thousands of teenagers have made the decision to have their bust reduced either for emotional reasons or because of medical problems such as osteoarthritis and curvature of the spine.

programme.title: The Detectives: My Killer Case
programme.desc: Disturbing crimes from across the UK are unpacked and retold in intimate detail through police files, CCTV footage and accounts from those who helped solve them.

programme.title: The Detectives: My Killer Case
programme.sub-title: Andrew Scanlan: Murder In The Woods
programme.desc: Disturbing crimes from across the UK are unpacked and retold in intimate detail through police files, CCTV footage and accounts from those who helped solve them.
